qas.question: What group wanted to conquer India from earliest times?
What empire took over parts of Afghanistan and Pakistan in 720?
Who was the final Hindu monarch of Sindh?
What Arab leader completed the early ambitions of Arabs by conquering parts of northern India?
How did the early Muslims view the possibility of conquering India?

context: The early Islamic literature indicates that the conquest of India was one of the very early ambitions of the <a0_0>Muslims<a0_0/>, though it was recognized as a particularly <a4_0>difficult<a4_0/> one. After conquering Persia, the <a1_0>Arab Umayyad Caliphate<a1_0/> incorporated parts of what are now Afghanistan and Pakistan around 720. The book Chach Nama chronicles the Chacha Dynasty's period, following the demise of the Rai Dynasty and the ascent of Chach of Alor to the throne, down to the Arab conquest by <a3_0>Muhammad bin Qasim<a3_0/> in the early 8th century AD, by defeating the last Hindu monarch of Sindh, <a2_0>Raja Dahir<a2_0/>.
